replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: It lets you evaluate contrast between foreground and background color (see screenshot 1). It has a magnified, keyboard controlled, color picker (see screenshot 2).

author: Jimi
message: Thank you for this great project! Is it available for non linux distributions? Will there be other colour spaces supported than rgb?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
I haven't tried Colorpick on anything else than Linux but I expect it to build on Windows and Mac OS, since all its dependencies (Qt 5, KF5GuiAddons and KF5WidgetsAddons) are available on these platforms. The only part I am unsure of is the color picker, which may not work on a non X11 environment.

Regarding color space, I plan to add support for HSV.

author: Tuukka Verho
message:
A suggestion: combine the contrast ratio label and the contrast example box! So instead of "contrast example" it says "contrast ratio 5:1 (good)" in the box.

Other comments: the copy button could be more associated with the text field, maybe somehow inside it? As for the up and down arrows, I cannot guess what they are supposed to do..?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
> combine the contrast ratio label and the contrast example box! So instead of "contrast example" it says "contrast ratio 5:1 (good)" in the box.

I like the idea, but I am worried about the text not being readable if... there is not enough contrast :)

> the copy button could be more associated with the text field, maybe somehow inside it?

That's a good suggestion, will look into it.

> As for the up and down arrows, I cannot guess what they are supposed to do..?

They allows you to adjust the value of the color, which makes it easy to fix contrast. I am probably going to either get rid of them when I add HSV support, or at least replace the arrows with icons.

replies.author: tom
replies.message: Also I would place the color pipette all the way to left, right next to the color box.
